alert.note: Alert for Lenawee; Monroe (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 23 at 3:52PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Monroe and Lenawee Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 351 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Fayette, or near Morenci, moving north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Morenci around 400 PM EDT. Hudson and Clayton around 415 PM EDT. Addison around 430 PM EDT. Onsted around 435 PM EDT. Cement City around 440 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Seneca, Manitou Beach-Devils Lake, Cone, Macon, Lime Creek, Munson, Ogden Center, Canandaigua, Ridgeway and Palmyra. Additional scattered thunderstorms in the vicinity may also produce small hail as they move north into the region. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for southeastern Michigan.
